channel.title: Homepage on We use computers to combat climate change.
channel.description: Recent content in Homepage on We use computers to combat climate change.

item.title: Xiaogang He
item.description: Assistant Professor of Civil and Environmental Engineering, College of Design and Engineering, National University of Singapore

item.title: Climate Downscaling
item.description: Hybrid statistical-dynamic downscaling based on multi-model ensembles What we are releasing We are releasing a bias-corrected and downscaled dataset based on 14 Coupled Model Intercomparison Project 6 (CMIP6) global climate models (GCMs) and the European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts Reanalysis 5 (ERA5) dataset. The dataset is simulated by ERA5 (3 domains) and GCMs (4 domains) forcing in NSCC HPC as shown in the following figure. What’s downscaling GCMs under CMIP6 have been widely used to investigate climate change impacts and put forward associated adaptation and mitigation strategies.

item.title: Climate Intelligence
item.description: High-precision climatic datasets and analytics in SE Asia What we are releasing We are releasing a bias-corrected and downscaled dataset based on 14 Coupled Model Intercomparison Project 6 (CMIP6) global climate models (GCMs) and the European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts Reanalysis 5 (ERA5) dataset. The dataset is simulated by ERA5 (3 domains) and GCMs (4 domains) forcing in NSCC HPC as shown in the following figure. What’s downscaling GCMs under CMIP6 have been widely used to investigate climate change impacts and put forward associated adaptation and mitigation strategies.

item.title: Data
item.description: The details of this dataset are given below. The dataset is simulated by WRF4.3 by ERA5 (3 domains) and GCM 6 hourly (4 domains) forcing in NSCC HPC All output is daily netcdf files with equal area projection at three domains (12.5km: south east Asia; 2.5km: around Singapore; 500m: singapore) Files include names with wrfout_d01_year-mon-day_00:00:00 (first running) and wrfout_d01_year-mon-day_03:00:00 (restart running) Every file has 8 timesteps (0,3,6,9,12,15,18,21 ; or 3,6,9,12,15,18,21,0) Due to the restart running,there are one or more files named by the same day.
